reviews.sentence: Love this place staff is so friendly breakfast wonderful. This Hampton Inn is so clean and the breakfast is delicious. The entire staff is always so friendly. I feel so comfortable in the lobby and love the location. They have a very nice little gym and again very clean. Did I say the breakfast is the best part.

Amazing hotel in an Amazing location. The staff here is absurdly kind and friendly and will go above and beyond to accommodate guests. The hotel is exactly where you want to be and in walking distance to a ton of great bars and restaurants. The hotel rooms are super nice with free wifi and all the amenities you could want. Highly recommend.
Lemon water in lobby.

Good location. Been staying at this hotel everytime come to UF nice facility clean room they could do a better job at front desk it is a nicely located in downtown with a lots of option for restaurantit is overprice for sure. I like their corner roms backside rooms are not quite.

Great business stay in Gainesville. The Hampton Inn and Suites has an excellent location close to great restaurants and bars comfortable and clean rooms and nice perks like free gummy bears in the lobby. Came with a conference group meeting at UF and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great place to stay. The valet was awesome three minute check in great lobby terrific room all clean and modern. There are great restaurants all around the area and it is still quiet in the room. East yo get to. great area I highly recommend you stay here.

Great stay. Helpful courteous friendly staff excellent location good sized clean rooms. The amenities are nice breakfast valet parking fitness center. Have stayed here several times before and would again.

Good hotel but staff lacks knowledge of the area. I visited end of October for a business trip. Pros great location and very nice room with basic amenities. Good breakfast. Near many restaurants. Good temp control. Cons you have to valet park. I forgot my charger and hotel did not keep such basics. I have stayed in some international locations where this is provided and put on your bill if you do not return. I can not believe there are none in lost and found. Hotel advised that I walked to CVS to purchase and it is safe to walk. I walked half a mile and it got scary and I learned that i walked into an unsafe area but hotel staff did not know. I can not believe hotel did not tell me. If you are staying then take a can to go anywhere beyond the safe distance which is a few blocks each way.

Such a nice place. I came to Gainesville for an interview and the interviewer paid for my hotel for two nights. it is not the kind of place I could afford. it is a wonderful place to stay though. The room was comfortable clean and quiet the free wifi is fast and there is a lot to see just walking around the area. I was lucky enough to arrive on a Wednesday night while the farmers market was going on across the street. The hot breakfast is a great touch as is the selection of complementary snacks and citrus infused water in the lobby.
Friendly staff accommodating lobby.

Great staff clean rooms but could use some updating. Great location in downtown. Wonderful front desk staff. I had informed them ahead that I wanted a room close to the elevator because of bad knees. When we arrived rather late in the night the front desk person greeted us warmly and informed us that they got my message and accordingly arranged a room on the second floor very close to the elevator and it was also on the same floor where breakfast was served. We appreciated that very much. We did not care much for the beds thought the mattresses and pillows were too soft. My wife and I both got up with stiff backs both nights because of the very soft mattresses. I thought most hotels had switched over to firmer mattresses. I guess this hotel has not gotten around to doing it yet. Other than the beds the room was comfortable and kept very clean. We thought parking was kind of high 16 per night for valet parking only slightly cheaper for self parking 15. This is rather steep considering it is a university town and this was not a game weekend.
Loved that the hotel was in midst of restaurants and live entertainment. I only wished for better parking accommodations.

Not up to the standards of Hampton anymore. I have stayed in this hotel a few times. Front desk service is great and the location for downtown Gainesville is perfect. Rooms are getting a little bit tired. Need to make special note of air conditioning not working great during the summer months and this is Florida where the summer is long. Rooms on the 4th floor constantly felt damp. You could have cool and damp or warm and damp. Not just my room but the rooms for my colleagues too. One other thing to note is the fitness room. When I stayed in the hotel in the spring there was a sign in the gym that said due to this weeks storm the treadmills and elliptical do not work. Unfortunately six months later the same sign remains and most of the equipment does not work. Including the air conditioning which I called the front desk about. They sent up someone from maintenance who tried to fix the controls on the wall. I pointed out to him that what he was working on was the control for the electronic scale not the air conditioning. Needless to say he gave up and had me leave the door to the gym open.

Rooms are getting a little bit tired. Need to make special note of air conditioning not working great during the summer months and this is Florida where the summer is long. Rooms on the 4th floor constantly felt damp. You could have cool and damp or warm and damp. Not just my room but the rooms for my colleagues too. One other thing to note is the fitness room. When I stayed in the hotel in the spring there was a sign in the gym that said due to this weeks storm the treadmills and elliptical do not work. Unfortunately six months later the same sign remains and most of the equipment does not work. Including the air conditioning which I called the front desk about. They sent up someone from maintenance who tried to fix the controls on the wall. I pointed out to him that what he was working on was the control for the electronic scale not the air conditioning. Needless to say he gave up and had me leave the door to the gym open.

Pool was nt open but not a big deal for this stay. Snack bar for purchase in lobby is just unbelievably priced high which is odd to me. Everything else was good but valet is 18 a night and everywhere else tows so be prepared for that.

Grunge hotel in the middle of downtown. Good location but very utilitarian inside. Noisy window AC unit. Dirty and basic polyester furniture. We stayed on the second floor where the elevators open directly into a makeshift dining area with public bathroom on one side and rooms on the other. Reminds me of a dirty college gym from 1980 ’s instead of a hotel. The staff were sullen and cut us off to catch the elevator no greetings or smiles. The whole thing appeared outdated and people are not happy to work there.

Best Ever Hampton Inn. We have visited this facility over eight different times in the past six months and have NEVER been disappointed in any area. The hotels staff are courteous accommodating and efficient. Having a student at UF we visit often and always look forward to the relaxing experience of staying at the Downtown Gainesville Hampton Inn.

Great location friendly service with a few bumps. I stayed here 4 nights for a conference. The rooms are clean and comfortable and you can not beat the location. Walking distance to Hippodrome Theater and so many great restaurants and stores. The staff was very friendly and breakfast was satisfying with a nice range of choices. However the air conditioning unit was very loud even on the lowest fan setting. Since the weather was generally warm turning it off was not an option. Also one elevator went out and then the other started working intermittently causing LOTS of lines and problems especially around check out time.
